QueryResults.Content:
Launching a game
      
      
      
      
         The phone includes some Java applications and games, and supports downloading new applications and games from different WAP
            services.
         
         
         
         
            Procedure
         
         
            
               Press Menu, and select Games and Select Game.
               
            
            
            
               Scroll to a game or a game set (name depends on the game).
               
            
            
            
               Press Options and select OK or press . If the selection is a single game it will be launched. Otherwise, a list of games in the selected game set is displayed.
                  To launch a single game, scroll to the desired game and press Options and select OK, or press .
               
            
            
         
         
         
         
            
               What to do next
            
            
            Attention: Note that running some games may consume the phoneâ€™s battery faster (and you may need to connect the phone to the charger).
            
            
            
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Games

Deleting messages
      
      
      
         
         
            Procedure
         
         
            
               To delete text messages, press Menu, and
                  select Messages, Text messages and Delete messages.
               
            
            
            
               To delete all messages from a folder, select the folder where you want to delete the messages and press OK. If the folder contains unread messages, the phone will ask whether you want to delete them also. 
               
            
            
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Messages

Keys overview
      
      
      
         
         
            
            
            
               
               Power key - Switches the phone on and off. Enables changing the profile when pressed briefly in standby mode.
               
               
               Volume key - For adjusting the volume of the earpiece, the headset and the loudspeaker.
               
               
               Music key - Shortcut key to quickly turn the Music player and Radio on and off.
               
               
               4-way scroll key - Enables scrolling through names, phone numbers, menus or settings. Also enables, for example, channel search
                  in the radio, adjusting the music settings, and the use of music functions, such as play, stop, fast forward and rewind.
               
               
               
               Recording key - To start recording when the radio is on or external audio equipment is connected to the phone.
               
               
               Selection keys - The function of the keys depends on the guiding text shown on the display above the keys.
                   dials a phone number, and answers a call. In standby mode it shows the most recently called numbers.
                  
                  
                   ends an active call. Exits from any function.
                  
                  
               
               
               
                -  enter numbers and characters. 
               
               
               
            
            
            
         
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Your phone

Your phone
      
      
      
      
         
         
         
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Keys overview
               
            
            
            Connectors overview
               
            
            
            Standby mode
               When the phone is ready for use, and you have not keyed in any characters, the phone is in standby mode. The name of the service
               provider/logo appears in the display.
            
            
            Essential indicators in standby mode
               
            
            
            Screen saver
               The phone automatically activates the screen saver, a digital clock view, for power saving in standby mode.
            
            
            General Packet Radio Service (GPRS)
               GPRS technology allows mobile phones to be used for sending and receiving data over the mobile network (network service).
            
            
            Bluetooth Connection
               You can transfer data from your phone to another compatible device, for example, a phone, a headset using Bluetooth technology.

Voice mailbox
      
      
      
      
         Voice mailbox is a network service and you may need to subscribe to it.
         
         
         
         Press Menu, and select Messages and Voice Messages. Select
            
               
               Listen to voice messages to call your Voice mailbox at the phone number that you have saved in the Voicemail number menu.
               
               
               
               Voicemail number to key in, search for or edit your Voicemail number and press OK to save it.
               
               
               
            
            
         
         
         
         
            
            
            If supported by the network, the indicator  will be shown if you have received new voice messages. Press Listen to call your voice mailbox number.
            
            
            
            Tip: Pressing and holding  calls your voice mailbox if you have saved the Voicemail number.
            
            
            
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Messages

DJ Game
      
      
      
      
         
         
         
         In this game you play a budding DJ in his quest for fame and fortune. 
         
         
         Guide him throughthe city collecting records and practicing his scratching to get ready for performing in clubs.
         
         
         Once you have the skills you will be requested to play in the coolest club in town. Will it be your breakthrough? It's all
            up to you!
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Games

Games
      
      
      
      
         Your phone supports Java 2 Micro Edition (J2METM), which is a version of Java technology specifically designed for small consumer
            electronics products. The phone includes some Java applications and games, and supports downloading new applications and games
            from different WAP services.
         
         
         
         
            
            
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Launching a game
               The phone includes some Java applications and games, and supports downloading new applications and games from different WAP
               services.
            
            
            Game Downloads
               The phone supports downloading new applications and games from different WAP services.
            
            
            Snake 2 Game
               Make the snake grow longer by directing it to the food.
            
            
            Water Rapids
               Steer your raft down six rivers.
            
            
            DJ Game

Listening to the radio
      
      
      
      
         
         
         
         
            
               Before you begin
            To listen to the radio on your phone connect a compatible headset to the phone. The lead of the headset functions as the antenna
            of the radio, so let it hang freely.
         
         
         
         
            Procedure
         
         
            
               Press the Music key and select Radio.
               
            
            
            
               To tune a channel, press and hold  or and the channel search starts. Searching stops when a channel is found.
               
            
            
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Music functions

Essential indicators in standby mode
      
      
      
      
         
         
         
          You have received one or several text or picture messages.
         
         
         
          You have received one or several multimedia messages.
         
         
         
          You have received one or several voice messages.
         
         
         
         The phoneâ€™s keypad is locked.
         
         
         
          A GPRS connection is established. The indicator is shown on the top left of the display. 
         
         
         
          The GPRS connection is suspended (on hold), for example if there is an incoming or outgoing call during a GPRS connection.
         
         
         
          The stopwatch timing is running in the background.
         
         
         
          The loudspeaker has been activated.
         
         
         
          Indicates that Bluetooth is active.
         
         
         
         Indicates that data is transmitted via Bluetooth.
         
         
         
      
      
      
      
         
         
            
            Parent topic: Your phone
